dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.
dependencies.name: tbb

dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.
dependencies.name: zlib-api

dependent_to.description:
The Biopieces are a collection of bioinformatics tools that can be
pieced together in a very easy and flexible manner to perform both
simple and complex tasks.
dependent_to.name: biopieces

dependent_to.description:
butter: Bowtie UTilizing iTerative placEment of Repetitive small rnas. A
wrapper for bowtie to produce small RNA-seq alignments where multimapped
small RNAs tend to be placed near regions of confidently high density.
dependent_to.name: butter

dependent_to.description:
CleaveLand4: Analysis of degradome data to find sliced miRNA and siRNA
targets
dependent_to.name: cleaveland4

dependent_to.description:
FastQ Screen allows you to screen a library of sequences in FastQ format
against a set of sequence databases so you can see if the composition of
the library matches with what you expect.
dependent_to.name: fastq-screen

dependent_to.description: HiCUP: a bioinformatics pipeline for processing Hi-C data
dependent_to.name: hicup

dependent_to.description:
MapSplice is a software for mapping RNA-seq data to reference genome for
splice junction discovery that depends only on reference genome, and not
on any further annotations.
dependent_to.name: mapsplice2

dependent_to.description:
miRDeep2 is a completely overhauled tool which discovers microRNA genes
by analyzing sequenced RNAs.
dependent_to.name: mirdeep2

dependent_to.description:
RSEM is a software package for estimating gene and isoform expression
levels from RNA-Seq data.
dependent_to.name: rsem

dependent_to.description:
ShortStack is a tool developed to process and analyze smallRNA-seq data
with respect to a reference genome, and output a comprehensive and
informative annotation of all discovered small RNA genes.
dependent_to.name: shortstack

dependent_to.description:
Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de
novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity
combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and
Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq
reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de
Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a
given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to
extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts
derived from paralogous genes.
dependent_to.name: trinity

description:
Bowtie is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner for short
DNA sequences (reads) from next-gen sequencers.
name: bowtie

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
